snippet: Republicans suggested to the agency’s chairman that he had exhausted his tools for stimulating growth responsibly. Democrats were happy to hear him recount the Fed’s successes.
abstract: House Republicans press Federal Reserve chairman Ben S Bernanke during Congressional testimony to forswear additional actions to stimulate growth, warning that the results would be counterproductive; Democrats are pleased to hear him recount the Fed's successes; survey of regional economic conditions in Federal Reserve's 12 districts finds most regions experienced modest growth..
lead_paragraph: Republicans suggested to the agency’s chairman that he had exhausted his tools for stimulating growth responsibly. Democrats were happy to hear him recount the Fed’s successes.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Says Further Fed Action Could Hurt Economy
headline.main: G.O.P. Says Fed Action Could Hurt Economy
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Says Fed Action Could Hurt Economy
